text:
Debra Anne Haaland (born December 2, 1960) is an American politician. She is the U.S. Representative for New Mexico's 1st congressional district since January 3, 2019.
She is a former Chair of the Democratic Party of New Mexico. She is one of the first two Native American women to be elected to Congress, alongside Sharice Davids, both in 2018.
On December 17, 2020, President-elect Joe Biden nominated Haaland to serve as United States Secretary of the Interior in his cabinet. If confirmed, she would become the first Native American to run the Department of the Interior. She would also be the first Native American (and Native American woman) Cabinet secretary in the history of the United States.
